question: 勝負
sourceMnemonic:
<kanji>Win</kanji>, <kanji>lose</kanji>... both will happen in tonight's <vocabulary>match</vocabulary>! What a <vocabulary>showdown</vocabulary> it will be!

Note that <ja>勝負</ja> can also describe situations where one takes a significant risk or makes a bold move— <vocabulary>a gamble </vocabulary>—with high stakes involved.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Just remember that <ja>ふ</ja> becomes <ja>ぶ</ja> because of rendaku here.
